intro: Rapanea boulindaensis, commonly known as the Boulinda evergreen, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Boulinda in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and related species. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically glossy and elliptical in shape. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by oval-shaped berries. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, Rapanea boulindaensis is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
